author: Matthew Horwood
description: The federal government’s buyback of recently banned firearms will cost approximately $342.6 million, based on police estimates of firearm ownership rates that are over a decade old. Marcia Jones, director general with the public safety department, testified before the Senate National Finance Committee that budgeted costs to collect 12,000 firearms were $20 million, but that […]
title: Firearms Buyback Program to Cost a Third of a Billion Dollars

author: Eva Fu
description: Director Patel says the documents detail ‘alarming allegations’ that ‘while substantiated, were abruptly recalled and never disclosed to the public.’
title: FBI Renews Scrutiny Over Handling of 2020 Election Interference Allegation Against China

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Australians have been urged to leave Iran if it is safe to do so as embassy operations on the ground are put on hold.
title: Australia Suspends Embassy in Tehran as Israel-Iran Tensions Continue

author: Tom Ozimek
description: The flight cancellations come as hostilities between Israel and Iran intensify, raising security concerns across the region.
title: American Airlines, United Suspend Middle East Flights Amid Israel-Iran Conflict

author: Chase Smith
description: Party leaders urge restraint and demand answers from the president, while others back Israeli strikes or stay silent on possible U.S. military action.
title: Democrats Split on US Intervention in Israel–Iran Conflict as Party Leaders Push for Diplomacy

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Attack on Hospital in Israel, Hurricane Erick, and Heat in Europe

author: Chandra Philip
description: The government of Nova Scotia is offering a cash reward of up to $150,000 for information in the disappearance of two young siblings from Pictou County in that province. Lilly Sullivan, 6, and Jack Sullivan, 4, were reported missing from their home on Gairloch Road in Lansdowne Station on May 2. It is about 140 […]
title: Nova Scotia Offers Reward up to $150,000 for Information to Help in Search for Missing Siblings

author: The Canadian Press
description: Canada Post says it has reached a contract deal with its second-largest union as negotiations continue with the Canadian Union of Postal Workers. The Crown corporation says the new collective agreement with the Canadian Postmasters and Assistants Association comes after 18 months of negotiations, the same span of time it’s been in talks with CUPW. […]
title: Canada Post Reaches Deal With Second-Largest Union, Negotiations Continue With CUPW

author: Chandra Philip
description: Alberta’s population nearly hit five million in the first part of 2025, largely due to interprovincial migration and permanent immigration, according to Statistics Canada. StatCan released population numbers for the first quarter of 2025 on June 18, indicating the population of larger provinces like Ontario and B.C. dropped during that time, while Alberta’s increased, continuing […]
title: Alberta Population Nears 5 Million, Remains Top Destination for Interprovincial Migration: StatCan

author: Alex Wu
description: The cheap crude oil flow from Iran to China might be cut off as the war continues.
title: Israel–Iran War May Jeopardize China’s $400 Billion Deal With Iran

author: Lee Hall
description: NTD’s Lee Hall sits down with author Philip Womack to discuss his recent piece on a study that yielded concerning results regarding the cognitive abilities of young people. Womack talks about why reading is important for youngsters and the stark consequences of a post-literate generation ruled by technology.
title: Children Have Stopped Reading–It’s Terrible for Our Future: Philip Womack

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Middle-income workers such as nurses, teachers, and first responders, are being “squeezed out” of the Greater Toronto and Hamilton area (GTHA) due to the region’s housing affordability crisis, a recent report suggests. “A growing number of residents in the GTHA who are working full-time and earning reasonable, middle-income wages cannot find homes to own or […]
title: Middle-Income Workers Earning up to $125,000 Cannot Afford to Live in GTA: Report

author: Chris Summers
description: This is a breakdown of what we know about the Iranian regime, the succession to Ali Khamenei, and the opposition groups hoping to take over.
title: Iran’s Splintered Opposition Wait in Shadows for Collapse of Regime

author: Matthew Horwood
description: News Analysis A secluded and sparsely populated town known for its profusion of polar bears has taken on more focus as Canada looks at ways to revamp its economy and open up new export routes. The northern port town of Churchill, on the west shore of Hudson Bay in northern Manitoba, was recently highlighted by […]
title: What’s the Potential for Canada’s Northern Port to Expand Trade Opportunities?

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith and Saskatchewan Premier Scott Moe are calling on Ottawa to make six changes to federal policies they say are necessary to “unleash” their provinces’ economies, arguing these changes will ultimately benefit Canadians and help make Canada the “strongest economy in the G7.” The two premiers held a joint press conference on […]
title: Alberta, Sask. Premiers Call for 6 Federal Changes to Develop Provincial Economies Amid Tariff Tensions

author: The Canadian Press
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney says Canada is taking steps to protect the steel and aluminum industries with new counter-tariffs and protectionist policies. The prime minister says Ottawa is introducing rules on June 30 that will limit federal procurement to using steel and aluminum from Canada and “reliable trading partners.” New tariffs will be imposed in […]
title: Canada Announces Retaliatory Measures on US Steel, Aluminum Tariffs

author: Jackson Richman
description: The timeline was set because of the "substantial chance of negotiations" in Iran in the near future, the White House press secretary said.
title: Trump to Decide on US Action in Iran Within 2 Weeks: White House

author: Bill Pan
description: The business leader points to China's export controls on rare earth elements as a major source of trade disruption.
title: European Companies Caught in Crossfire of US–China Tensions, EU Business Head Says

author: The Canadian Press
description: The parliamentary budget officer said Thursday he expects the federal government’s deficit will balloon this year thanks to ramped-up defence spending—but without a spring budget or more clarity from Ottawa, he can’t say for sure. Yves Giroux, the government’s fiscal watchdog, issued a new economic and fiscal update Thursday that omits the usual deficit projections […]
title: Budget Officer Says He Expects Ramped-Up Defence Spending to Deepen Deficit

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: The average household in Canada spends one-third less on groceries than a similar household in the United States, a new survey suggests. A typical weekly food budget in Canada is CA$179, while in the United States, it is US$203, which is equivalent to roughly CA$277, the study conducted by Leger found. The survey included 1,626 […]
title: Canadians Spending Less on Groceries Than Americans, Survey Finds

author: PA Media
description: Zhenhao Zou, 28, was jailed for life with a minimum term of 24 years.
title: Chinese Student Who Raped 10 Women Is ‘One of the Most Prolific Predators’

author: The Canadian Press
description: The finance minister says Canada won’t put a hold on its digital services tax on big tech companies, set to take effect on June 30. Pressure has mounted on Ottawa to pause the tax ahead of trade discussions with the U.S. Finance Minister François-Philippe Champagne told reporters the legislation was passed by Parliament and Canada […]
title: Champagne Says Canada Won’t Pause Digital Services Tax

author: Jack Phillips
description: Earlier this week, Trump suggested that U.S. intelligence knows where Iranian leader Ali Khamenei is located and could kill him in an airstrike.
title: Trump Responds to WSJ Report He Approved Attack Plan Targeting Iran

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: A Bloc Québécois bill aimed at preserving Canada’s supply management system during future trade negotiations is on the verge of becoming law after receiving Senate approval. Private member’s Bill C-202 successfully passed through both the House and the Senate on June 18, and is now pending royal assent to be officially enacted as law. The […]
title: Senate Approves Legislation That Makes Supply Management Off-Limits in Trade Negotiations

author: Epoch Video
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu visits Soroka hospital in southern Israel after it was hit by an Iranian missile on Thursday.
title: REPLAY: Netanyahu Visits Soroka Hospital in Beersheba After Iranian Strike

author: Jack Phillips
description: Israel's defense minister said that Ali Khamenei 'should not continue to exist.'
title: Israel Threatens Iranian Leader Khamenei After Missile Hits Hospital

author: Victoria Friedman
description: The bill's sponsor, Labour MP Kim Leadbeater, has said she is confident it will pass in the final stage in the House of Commons and will progress to the Lords.
title: Concerns Remain over Potential Loopholes in Assisted Suicide Bill as MPs Ready for Major Vote

author: The Canadian Press
description: Foreign Affairs Minister Anita Anand says Ottawa is helping Canadians leave the Middle East once they reach countries bordering Israel and Iran. With airports closed across the region, Ottawa has stationed consular officials on the other side of certain crossings on the Israeli and Iranian borders to help those fleeing either country to get home. […]
title: Canada Facilitating Commercial Flights Home for Citizens Fleeing Israel, Iran: Anand

author: Noé Chartier
description: The director of Canada’s spy agency is warning about the state of social cohesion in the country. Daniel Rogers, director of the Canadian Security Intelligence Agency (CSIS), made the comment in the agency’s annual report for 2024, which was publicly released on June 18. “Our social cohesion has been weakening in recent years, creating cleavages […]
title: Canada’s Spy Chief Says Social Cohesion ‘Weakening’ Amid Threats Like Terrorism, Foreign Interference

author: Owen Evans
description: New Zealand Foreign Minister Winston Peters said the island nation needs to take 'concrete steps to repair the relationship and restore trust.'
title: New Zealand Cuts Millions in Funding to Cook Islands Over China Ties

author: The Canadian Press
description: Canada should allow 100 percent foreign ownership of domestic-only airlines, the Competition Bureau says in a new report highlighting the country’s “highly concentrated” aviation industry. In a market study released Thursday, the watchdog suggested creating a new class of airline that operates only in Canada but could have owners from outside its borders, opening the […]
title: Watchdog Recommends up to 100% Foreign Airline Ownership Amid Low Competition

author: PA Media
description: The Bank of England’s Monetary Policy Committee decided to keep rates unchanged at 4.25 percent.
title: UK Interest Rates Kept on Hold With Bank Alert to ‘Highly Unpredictable’ World

author: Epoch Video
description: Views of various skylines and ground shots after Iran fires missiles at Israel on June 19.

description: 'These are war crimes of the most serious kind, and Khamenei will be held accountable for his crimes,' Israeli Defense Minister Israel Katz said.
title: Iranian Missile Strikes Hospital in Southern Israel

description: Israel continued to target Iran's nuclear facilities overnight, hitting a heavy water reactor
title: Israel Says Iran’s Leader ‘Cannot Exist Anymore’, After Missile Hits Hospital

description: The Israeli Air Force said the strikes also hit military production sites that produced and assembled ballistic missiles.
title: Israel Hits 2 Iranian Nuclear Sites, Iran Retaliates

author: PA Media
description: The foreign secretary will meet counterpart Marco Rubio in Washington, D.C. on Thursday.
title: David Lammy Heads to US for Crisis Talks Over Israel–Iran Conflict

description: Twenty-five of Australia’s 36 universities fell in the latest QS World University Rankings.
title: Australia’s Global University Rankings Slide as Asia Gains Ground

description: Rental housing developers will keep tax breaks and be allowed to build their own infrastructure.

description: The Guatemalan drug traffickers are alleged to have trafficked drugs into Mexico with the help of notorious Mexican cartels.

description: Australia’s labour market looks steady—but falling participation, slowing hours, and underutilisation expose growing weakness.

description: New study reveals hot water baths may help heart failure patients walk further—without medication.

description: The AEMC has also rolled out new rules to protect 'vulnerable' customers.

description: The federal government is assisting overland escape from Israel; options to Egypt also explored.

author: Tom Ozimek
description: The twice-a-year HIV prevention shot from Gilead has won regulatory approval after trials showed near-total protection.

author: Joseph Lord
description: Republicans have been sharply divided over whether or not to intervene in the ongoing Israel-Iran war.
title: Trump Says Tucker Carlson Apologized as Republican Debate Over Israel–Iran War Continues

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Rights groups are renewing calls for Ottawa to support Hong Kong pro-democracy activist Jimmy Lai after the federal government paused a motion to grant him honorary Canadian citizenship last week. The Toronto Association for Democracy in China and the Canadian Coalition on Human Rights in China issued a joint press release on June 18, asking […]
title: Rights Groups Press Ottawa to Reverse Blockage of Motion in Support of Hong Kong Democracy Activist Jimmy Lai

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Conservative and Bloc Québécois MPs raised concerns with the One Canadian Economy Act as federal ministers testified before the Transport Committee, questioning whether the bill grants the government sweeping authority to exempt projects from existing laws without including clear and reasonable limits on that power. Conservative MP Leslyn Lewis on June 18 compared Bill C-5, which […]
title: Conservative, Bloc MPs Ask if Major Projects Bill Infringes Rights, Allows for Similar Powers as Emergencies Act

author: Chandra Philip
description: The government of Alberta is allocating $1.2 million into a non-profit program that will help military veterans transition into the workforce. The program, called Forces@WORK, was started by Prospect Human Services in 2011 and has helped 1,300 veterans and public safety personnel find work in civilian careers, according to the government. Minister of Assisted Living […]
title: Alberta to Allocate $1.2 Million Into Program to Help Veterans Transition to Civilian Life

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Footage posted online shows the Landcruiser smashing through glass doors as terrified shoppers ducked for cover inside nearby stores.
title: Police Arrest Driver of Stolen SUV That Plowed Through Melbourne Mall
